channel.title: Voyage
channel.description: A place to put thoughts; who knows where they'll lead?

item.title: RAII in Julia
item.description: RAII is a very powerful technique for managing access to external shared resources in C++. Is there an equivalent in Julia, and if so, how can we take advantage of it?

item.title: Antithesis is not enough
item.description: A look at determinism and why it's required, but not sufficient for good testing

item.title: Error Shrinking: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
item.link: https://seelengrab.github.io/articles/Error Shrinking: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly/index.html
item.guid: https://seelengrab.github.io/articles/Error Shrinking: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly/index.html
item.description: We're looking at how errors and their messages in Julia behave (or don't!) when they interact with property based testing using Supposition.jl.

item.title: The Properties of QuickCheck, Hedgehog and Hypothesis
item.link: https://seelengrab.github.io/articles/The properties of QuickCheck, Hedgehog and Hypothesis/index.html
item.guid: https://seelengrab.github.io/articles/The properties of QuickCheck, Hedgehog and Hypothesis/index.html
item.description: An overview & comparison of the approaches taken by the property based testing frameworks QuickCheck, Hedgehog and Hypothesis.

item.title: Julia Abstractions for Arduino registers
item.description: A followup post about building zero-cost abstractions for Julia on microcontrollers using a few new support packages.

item.title: Running Julia baremetal on an Arduino
item.description: A writeup about how I got Julia code running baremetal on an Arduino Ethernet R3, which features an ATmega328p, LLVM-IR as well as AVR assembly.

item.title: About some responses to that "Correctness in julia" post
item.link: https://seelengrab.github.io/articles/About some responses to that "Correctness in Julia" post/index.html
item.guid: https://seelengrab.github.io/articles/About some responses to that "Correctness in Julia" post/index.html
item.description: A short commentary on the responses to "Why I no longer recommend Julia" Post by Yuri Vishnevsky
